data.title: New Era Senior Secondary School Vadodara
data.text:
26/08/2024

New Era Preschool celebrated Janmashtami with delight and enthusiasm, immersing the children in the rich traditions of the festival.

Children, dressed in traditional chaniya choli and kurtas added a special charm to the festival.

The day began with melodious devotional songs dedicated to Lord Krishna. The little ones sang bhajans with innocent fervor, filling the atmosphere with devotion and excitement.

Children from FS 2 performed dances, dressed as Radha and Krishna. Their vibrant costumes and synchronized steps brought the spirit of Vrindavan to life.

A dramatic enactment of Krishna’s birth followed, with the teachers narrating and enacting the story of Devaki and Vasudeva making it engaging and memorable.

Krishna's presence was evoked by performing Aarti with all the teachers and children participating in offering prayers to their beloved Krishna Bhagwan.

The highlight of the day was the "Matki Phod" event where the children joyfully re enacted Krishna's love for Makkhan, breaking the pot just like little Krishna used to steal butter from the hanging Matki.

The celebration concluded with Garba in which all the classes came together, dancing in a circle with cheerful energy, making it a perfect end to the festive day.https://fb.watch/ubD7tuKGsv/

17/08/2024

The New Era Senior Secondary School was transformed into a microcosm of the global stage as it hosted the fourth edition of its annual Model United Nations conference.; NESMUN. The conference commenced with a vibrant opening ceremony. Anchored by Nivedita Bakshi and Alina Parmar, the event welcomed distinguished guests: Chief Guest Dr. Pawan Dwivedi, Principal Ms. Leena Nair, Vice Principal Ms. Mary Kutty, and Convener Dr. Susmita Basu. A traditional lamp lighting and prayer invoked blessings for the conference. Inspiring speeches by the Chief Guest and Principal followed. The Secretary-General officially declared the NESMUN open, marking the beginning of intense deliberations and diplomatic engagements. Lok Sabha was a battleground of diplomacy, with the contentious Uniform Civil Code igniting fiery debate. Delegates, assuming the roles of Indian politicians, clashed with the intensity of a political arena, their arguments echoing the nation’s divisive discourse. The atmosphere was electric as they navigated the complexities of religion, gender, and law. The United Nations Human Rights Council provided a global perspective. Belarus, Russia, and New Zealand took center stage, each nation presenting its unique challenges in upholding human rights. The UN Security Council was a cauldron of geopolitical tensions, with the Israeli-Palestinian conflict dominating the agenda. Delegates grappled with complex diplomatic issues, their words carrying the weight of nations. The focus shifted back to domestic policy in Lok Sabha, where agricultural concerns took the spotlight. Young minds delved into the intricacies of India's agrarian economy, proposing solutions and debating government policies. The session showcased a remarkable understanding of complex economic issues. As the day concluded, the participants emerged from the conference rooms, their minds expanded and their perspectives broadened. The inaugural day of NESMUN had been a resounding success, laying the groundwork for what promised to be an intense and rewarding experience.

https://fb.watch/t-QWILB3mZ/ #NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #Nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity #Nesss #nesmun

05/08/2024

NESSS Storms to Victory: Navlit Champions Trophy Finds New Home!

In a dazzling display of talent and creativity, New Era Senior Secondary School (NESSS) emerged triumphant at the prestigious Navrachna Sama Inter-School Competition, securing the coveted "Navlit Champions Trophy" amidst a spectacular celebration of academic and artistic prowess.

The crowning glory of this momentous win was marked by sharing it with the visionary Managing Trustee Dr Geetika Madan Patel.

Her presence, like a beacon of inspiration, illuminated the win of both the victorious and the valiant participants alike.

NESSS students showcased their exceptional skills across multiple disciplines, leaving audiences and judges alike in awe.

NESSS students exhibited their multifaceted talents, clinching top honors in various categories:

a. Crossroad (Street Play) - 1st Prize

Winners – Aarohi Patil, Amrita Nayar, Sreenika Mayur, Gagan Krishan

The thespians of NESSS captivated the audience with their powerful performance, claiming the top spot in this dramatic category.

b. Puppet Palooza - 1st Prize

Winners – Sahaj Patel, Devaj Bhardwaj

NESSS puppeteers pulled all the right strings, securing first place with their mesmerizing marionette mastery.

c. Solo Spotlight - 2nd Prize

Winners – Kirty Abhani, Durva Vyas

A stellar solo performance earned NESSS a well-deserved second place, showcasing individual brilliance on the grand stage.

d. Groovy Moovye - 3rd Position

Winners – Krishna Thakkar

NESSS dancers grooved their way to the podium, securing third place with their rhythmic prowess.

New Era Senior Secondary School extends its heartfelt congratulations to all the victorious participants and their dedicated mentors. Their outstanding performances have not only brought glory to the school but have also set a new benchmark for excellence in inter-school competitions.

https://www.facebook.com/share/p/reaRTvkz34iDZCPq/?mibextid=oFDknk

#NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity #navlit

03/08/2024

“Winning isn’t important, but wanting to win is.”

THE CLASH OF THE TITANS: NESSS Houses Battle for Supremacy in Hoops and Kicks Showdown

The sports arena of New Era Senior Secondary School (NESSS) was transformed into a battleground of athletic prowess as students of SS1 and SS2 engaged in a spectacular display of skill, strategy, and spirit during the recent Inter-house Basketball and Football (Sports) Competitions.

The four houses clashed in heart-stopping football matches and pulse-pounding basketball showdowns, leaving spectators thoroughly exuberant and yearning for more.

Bugles for Hoop Winners:

* Girls’ Basketball Tournament:

Samya House rose like a phoenix to claim the victory against the tough opponents. With the display of indomitable spirit, Ekta House secured a well-deserved runners-up position.

* Boys’ Basketball Tournament:

Maitree House emerged as the undisputed monarchs of the court. On the other hand, Pragati House showcased remarkable resilience, to clinch the runners-up spot.

Trumpets for Football Warriors:

The football pitch became a winning arena for Samya House. Maitree House fought tooth and nail to secure the runners-up position.

The event drew enthusiastic support from students and teachers alike, creating an electric atmosphere that emphasized the school's strong sense of community.

This year's Inter-house Sports Competitions will be remembered as a testament to NESSS's commitment to holistic education, blending academic excellence with athletic achievement.

What an extraordinary showcase of talent, teamwork, and tenacity!

01/08/2024

NESSS Mission: Perking up the Passion for Reading in All New Eraites

One Book Every Month!

The August Month’s Book Bliss includes:

Foundational Stage 4 & 5: "Little Hands Make a Big Difference," authored by Arunima Aggarwal is a heartwarming tale set in the vibrant month of October. The story follows Walnut, a tree laden with ripe walnuts, and Brownie, a little squirrel who finds joy and sustenance in the tree's bounty. As the season progresses, Walnut expresses concern about the depleting walnuts, prompting Brownie to take action by storing food for the winter. The book is a delightful read for children, emphasizing the values of cooperation and coexistence.

Preparatory Stage 1: "Marching to Freedom" by Subhadra Sen Gupta is a captivating children's story that immerses readers in the historical and inspiring journey of Mahatma Gandhi's Dandi March. Set in the Sabarmati Ashram near Ahmedabad, the story follows nine-year-old Dhani, who is eager to join Gandhi and his followers in their protest against the British-imposed salt tax. The book beautifully captures the spirit of resilience and unity that marked the Salt March, making it an engaging and educational read for young readers.

Preparatory Stage 2 & 3: "We, the Children of India" by Leila Seth is an insightful introduction to the Indian Constitution, specifically written for young readers. Authored by the esteemed former Chief Justice of India, Leila Seth, the book aims to educate children about the values and principles enshrined in the Constitution. This book is not just a lesson in civics but a call to young citizens to appreciate and uphold the democratic values that form the bedrock of the nation.

Middle Stage 1 & 2: "I Survived: The Eruption of Mount St. Helens, 1980" is a children's historical fiction novel by Lauren Tarshis. It follows the story of 11-year-old Jessie who is visiting her grandparents near Mount St. Helens when the volcano suddenly erupts. Jessie must use her wits and courage to survive the disaster and find her family amidst the chaos and destruction. The book combines real historical events with fictional characters to provide a gripping and educational story about one of the most significant volcanic eruptions in American history.

Middle Stage 3 & Secondary Stage 1: “The Girl of Ink and Stars” by Kiran Millwood Hargrave is a beautifully written story of a young girl, Isabella, and her best friend, Lupe. When Lupe goes missing, Isabella does everything she can to be part of the search party. She is in possession of an ancient map and uses this and her knowledge of the stars to navigate the forgotten territories of her island home. The land is dangerous and shrouded in myth. Isabella must find Lupe before these myths become more than just stories.

Secondary Stage 2,3 & 4: “Shoot, Dive, Fly: Stories of Grit and Adventure from The Indian Army” by Rachna Bisht Rawat aims to introduce teenagers to the armed forces and tell them about the perils-the rigours and the challenges-and perks-the thrill and the adventure-of a career in uniform. Flying fighter planes, detonating bombs, skinning and eating snakes in times of dire need, and everything else in between-there's nothing our officers can't do!. Read twenty-one nail-biting stories of daring.

#NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity #bookofthemonth2024

29/07/2024

“Teamwork gives you the best opportunity to turn vision into reality.” - John Maxwell

NESSS Teams Up with Microsoft to Elevate Educator Excellence in Practical Workshop

NESSS continues to champion lifelong learning, as demonstrated in the recent Microsoft workshop attended by over 70 passionate educators. Under the expert guidance of Suraj Shetkar (Sr. Program Manager at Juana Technologies Private Limited) the participants explored the functionalities of Microsoft Teams, Microsoft 365, OneNote, Minecraft, and more.

The workshop provided teachers with a wealth of knowledge, by equipping them with the tools and strategies needed to elevate their teaching practices and enhance classroom experiences. The session assisted attendees with hands on experience to learn and add the Midas touch of technology into their TL journey.

As Ralph Waldo Emerson aptly stated, “The mind, once stretched by a new idea, never returns to its original dimensions.” With ever changing times in education, every facilitator needs to turn an overleaf in delivering content to its pupils. The session met this purpose. Besides, it even highlights NESSS’s unwavering commitment to empowering educators and reaffirming our belief in the importance of continuous professional development to achieve educational excellence. New Era teachers eagerly anticipate to further this journey of learning and innovation to ensure New Eraites receive an unparalleled educational experience.

#NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity

01/07/2024

The Book of the Month Program – JULY 2024

As lovers of literature and advocates for lifelong learning, New Era Senior Secondary School believes that reading is not only essential but also immensely enjoyable. With this program, we aim to cultivate a vibrant reading culture and provide New Eraites with enriching literary experiences.

1. Foundational Stage 4 - "Little Ant's Big Plan" is a heartwarming children's story written by Candice Dingwall and illustrated by Steven McKimmie. This delightful tale follows the adventures of Little Ant, a young ant who loves to read, much to the confusion and frustration of his fellow ants who believe their primary duty is to gather food. Join Little Ant on his big adventure and discover how a love for reading can make a significant difference.

2. Foundational Stage 5 & Preparatory Stage 1- "Stage Fright," written by Yamini Vijayan and illustrated by Somesh Kumar, is a charming story available on Storyweaver that explores the journey of a young girl named Champa who loves to sing but is terrified of performing on stage.

3. Preparatory Stage 2 & 3 - The Giraffe and the Pelly and Me" by Roald Dahl is a tale about an unusual trio—a giraffe, a pelican, and a monkey—who form a window-cleaning company. The story begins with a young boy named Billy who encounters the extraordinary animals and becomes their friend. This delightful narrative is filled with Dahl's signature humor and charm, making it a beloved story for children and adults.

4. Middle Stage 1 & 2– “Famous Five: Part 1: Five on a Treasure Island” by Enid Blyton is the first book in the popular Famous Five series. This thrilling adventure introduces readers to a group of young friends and their quest for hidden treasure on a mysterious island. Enid Blyton, a beloved British children’s author, weaves a tale of excitement, friendship, and discovery that has captivated generations of readers.

5. Middle Stage 3 & Secondary Stage 1 - "Daddy-Long-Legs" by Jean Webster is a enchanting epistolary novel. The story unfolds through the letters of Jerusha "Judy" Abbott, an orphaned girl whose life transforms when an anonymous benefactor offers to sponsor her college education on the peculiar condition that she write him regular letters detailing her progress. The novel is not just a delightful, humorous read but a touching exploration of independence, friendship, and timeless classic.

6. Secondary Stage 2, 3 & 4 - Rich Dad Poor Dad is a 1997 book written by Robert T. Kiyosaki and Sharon Lechter. It advocates the importance of financial literacy (financial education), financial independence and building wealth through investing in assets, real estate investing, starting and owning businesses, as well as increasing one's financial intelligence

#NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity #NESSSBookoftheMonth2024

29/06/2024

NESSS Inter-house Sports Competitions Ignite School Spirit with Unforgettable Battles

NESSS buzzed with energy and excitement as the Inter-house Sports Competitions for MS2 and MS3 students took center stage. This exciting event, embodying the essence of teamwork and resilience, featured thrilling volleyball clashes and intense basketball showdowns on the court. Participants demonstrated exceptional collaboration and determination, making the morning a memorable celebration of sportsmanship and spirited competition.

Samya House Girls Triumph in Basketball Clashes

In the girls' basketball clashes, the Samya House Team emerged as the triumphant champion while the Maitree House Team secured the runners-up position.

Ekta House Boys Net Victory in Basketball Matches

In the boys' basketball clashes, the Ekta House Team emerged as victorious champions while the Pragati House Team secured the runners-up position.

Boys Volleyball Showdown

In the volleyball arena for boys, applause went to the Pragati House Team for clinching a clear victory, while the Ekta House Team demonstrated commendable performance as the runners-up.

Girls Volleyball Showdown

In the volleyball arena for girls, applause went to the Samya House Team for clinching a clear victory, while the Maitree House Team demonstrated commendable performance as the runners-up.

The events were a perfect blend of stamina, speed, strength, skill, and spirit.

As the curtains fall on this month’s inter-house activities, we at NESSS reflect with pride on the creativity, dedication, and teamwork displayed by New Eraites. These events not only fostered a spirit of healthy competition but also nurtured invaluable skills and lasting memories. At NESSS we eagerly anticipate the next month of inter-house activities - an overleaf to change in and out.

#NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity #interhousesportscompetition2024

27/06/2024

NESSS Catalyzes Educational Excellence in Gyan Sarovar Sahodaya Workshops 2024 - A Confluence of 200+ Educational Leaders

New Era Senior Secondary School played host to transformative Gyan Sarovar Sahodaya Workshops on Saturday, June 22, 2024, drawing over 200 educators from schools in and around Vadodara. The event got an auspicious start with lamp lighting by the School Heads and Resource persons. This comprehensive event spanned an entire day, serving as a pivotal platform for educational luminaries to delve into the intricacies of the National Curriculum Framework.

The primary objectives of the workshops were to empower attendees, equipping them with the requisite technical prowess to adeptly integrate the framework within their educational settings. Distinguished educators, Ms. Deepa Garg (NESSS), Ms. Sakina Giniwala (Cygnus), and Ms. Shalini Moray (Navrachana) led engrossing sessions focusing on English, Mathematics, and Environmental Science across Foundational Stages 4 & 5. Ms. Zenat Buddhvani, the School Counselor and Special Educator, conducted a short but an insightful session for FS4 & FS5 attendees on understanding students' concerns in the classroom. She shared a variety of effective strategies with the attendees to help address these concerns, fostering a more supportive and inclusive learning environment.

Moreover, NESSS educators Ms. Priya Nayar and Ms. Rashmi Patel guided discussions and conducted varied activities pertinent to assessments and pedagogies in English education spanning Middle Stages 1 -3. Each of the approximately 200 participants departed enriched, having gleaned invaluable insights and actionable strategies tailored for immediate application within their own educational institutions.

#NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity #GyanSarovarSahodayaWorkshop2024

#sahodaya

22/06/2024

Honouring the Class of 2024: A Grand Farewell and Celebration of Achievements Amidst an air of anticipation and nostalgia, the New Era Senior Secondary School community gathered to bid a heartfelt farewell to the remarkable Class of 2024. This Grand Formal See-Off and Appreciation Ceremony marked the culmination of their academic journey in class XII, celebrating their accomplishments and sending them forth on new adventures. On June 15, 2024, the Deen Dayal Upadhyay Auditorium in Waghodia came alive with excitement. The management, dedicated teachers, proud families, and enthusiastic students assembled to honor the graduating class. The hall buzzed with anticipation as everyone awaited the commencement of this momentous event. The occasion was graced by luminaries who have shaped education and excellence. Dr. Praggya M. Singh, Director (Academics- Assessments) CBSE, stood as the distinguished Chief Guest. Alongside her were the dynamic trio: Dr. Devanshu Patel, the visionary President; Dr. Geetika Patel, and Dr. Komal Patel, the distinguished Managing Trustees of NESSS. Also in attendance were Mrs. P.S. Kelkar, the Director, Mrs. Leena Nair, the Principal, Mrs. Marykutty K.T., the Vice-Principal, and Mrs. Deepa Garg, the Headmistress. The presence of these dignitaries added prestige and significance to the proceedings. The academic procession, led by the school Head Boy and Head Girl, followed by student achievers, teachers, Heads of the institution, and dignitaries, made its way to the stage. The audience rose in unison, offering a resounding standing ovation—a testament to these young achievers' hard work, dedication, and resilience. As the ceremony unfolded, certificates and special merit awards were bestowed upon the rankers and subject toppers across the three streams. The heart of the event lay in the captivating addresses delivered by the esteemed Chief Guest and the Managing Trustees. Their words resonated with hope, encouragement, and wisdom. The President’s anecdotes, in particular, left an indelible mark, inspiring the graduates to stay rooted to the ‘Value System’ and tread ahead with a Positive Attitude and have a bent for ‘Competent Aptitude’. Mrs. Leena Nair, Principal of NESSS, took the audience on an enlightening journey. Her concise yet compelling report highlighted the school’s remarkable achievements, memorable events, and milestones of the year 2024. From academic triumphs to cultural endeavors, each chapter was a testament to the spirit of New Eraites. As the curtains fell on this celebration, 147 young boys and girls stood at the threshold of new beginnings. Their achievements were etched into the annals of New Era’s legacy, and their futures glimmered with promise. The Class of 2024 had left an indelible mark—one that would resonate through time.

https://fb.watch/sSn7jeOs_R/

#NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity #convocation2024

12/06/2024

Empowering NESSS Educators for 21st-Century Teaching-Learning

During a two-day workshop on June 5 & 6, 2024 led by Mrs. Rupa Arun, a distinguished education specialist and member of NESSS Advisory team, educators at NESSS strode on the pathway to explore better pedagogies to incorporate their lesson plans with 21st-century skills and promote educational excellence. Educators were informed about the necessity of curriculum road maps and its’ various essential elements, in various subjects. Following that, through interactive sessions and hands-on activities, the educators meticulously developed personalized curriculum roadmaps for their upcoming classes in their respective subjects. Mrs. Rupa Arun's guidance ensured that each roadmap acted as a compass directing students towards success.

The following day was filled with a flurry of creativity. Teachers delved into a plethora of activities to incorporate into their lesson plans in alignment with their curriculum formats. They refined their teaching methods, from instructional approaches to evaluation methods. Various departments participated in personalized conversations with the resource person, addressing their concerns and perfecting their strategies to adopt in their lesson plans.

The workshop equipped educators with state-of-the-art resources, enabling them to establish interactive educational settings. With a firm step forward into the modern era, NESSS educators are ready to spark curiosity, encourage innovation, and cultivate the future cohort of students.

#NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity

10/06/2024

#NESSS Mission: Perking up the Passion for Reading in All New Eraites

One Book Every Month!

The June Month’s Book Bliss includes:

Foundational Stage 4 : “A Special Nest”, written by Kavita Singh and illustrated by Partho Sengupta, is a delightful children's story that follows the determined efforts of a bird to find a secure and peaceful place to build her nest. As winter approaches, the bird diligently gathers twigs and constructs a cozy home, only to face numerous challenges and disruptions. From an elephant using her tree to scratch its back to a painter who throws her nest away, the bird's persistence is tested. However, her creativity and hard work lead her to a unique solution that ensures her nest remains undisturbed. This heartwarming tale emphasizes resilience, problem-solving, and the pursuit of a safe shelter against all odds.

Foundational Stage 5 & Preparatory Stage 1 : "The Cat in the Hat," written by Dr. Seuss, is a classic piece of children's literature that has charmed generations of young readers. The story unfolds on a dreary, rainy day with two siblings, Sally and her brother, stuck indoors with nothing to do. Their monotonous day is turned upside down by the unexpected arrival of the mischievous Cat in the Hat, who brings chaos and fun into their home. With his tall striped hat and a penchant for trouble, the Cat, along with his unpredictable companions Thing 1 and Thing 2, embarks on a series of mischievous antics that challenge the children’s sense of responsibility. This beloved tale, with its simple yet engaging rhymes and vibrant illustrations, captures the imagination. It also teaches the valuable lessons about creativity, spontaneity and the balance between fun, responsibility and discipline.

Preparatory Stage 2 & 3: “Sir M. Visvesvaraya: The Builder of Dams, Bridges, and a Nation" is a captivating tale that celebrates the life and achievements of one of India's most renowned engineers and statesmen, Sir M. Visvesvaraya. Through vibrant storytelling, the narrative sheds light on Visvesvaraya's remarkable contributions to India's infrastructure development during the early 20th century. From the construction of dams to the engineering of bridges, this story offers a glimpse into the visionary mind and indomitable spirit of a man who dedicated his life to shaping the nation's future.

Middle Stage 1 & 2 : "Space Exploration for Kids" by Dr. Bruce Betts is an engaging introduction to the wonders of space for young readers. Dr. Betts, a renowned planetary scientist, simplifies complex concepts about space exploration, making them accessible and fascinating for children. Filled with colorful illustrations and fun activities, the book encourages curiosity and exploration, inspiring the next generation of space enthusiasts. With clear explanations and interactive elements, it's the perfect educational resource for budding astronauts and astronomers.

Middle Stage 3 & Secondary Stage 1: "Ahimsa" by Supriya Kelkar is a powerful novel set in 1942 India during the struggle for independence. It follows the journey of Anjali, a young girl who becomes involved in the freedom movement. Through her eyes, readers witness the challenges and sacrifices made by ordinary people fighting against British colonial rule. Kelkar's storytelling skillfully explores themes of nonviolence, courage, and social justice.

Secondary Stage 2, 3 & 4 : "The False Prince" by Jennifer A. Nielsen is an enthralling tale of intrigue, deception, and adventure. Set in the fictional kingdom of Carthya, the story follows Sage, an orphan, as he is chosen to impersonate the long-lost prince in a dangerous plot to seize the throne. With its memorable characters and unpredictable plot, "The False Prince" is a captivating read.

#NewEraSeniorSecondarySchool #newerarocks #nesss #VadodaraNewsOnline #vadodaranews #paruluniversity #NESSSBookoftheMonth

17/05/2024

“Student Leadership is the capacity to influence others through inspiration, generated by a passion, motivated by a vision, produced by conviction, ignited by a purpose.”

Leading with Passion: Meet the Trailblazers of NESSS’ Cabinet Team!

On these lines NESSS proudly announces the appointment of its esteemed student leaders for the academic year 2024-25. Although the school will have the formal Investiture Ceremony on 15th August 2024, but the council was introduced to the students. Amidst a spirited school assembly, the torch of leadership was passed to a cohort of exceptional individuals, marking a pivotal moment in the school's commitment to fostering excellence and nurturing leadership among its student body.

Chosen for their exemplary leadership qualities, dedication to service, and unwavering commitment to the school's values, the newly appointed student leaders represent the very best of New Era School. Their selection follows a rigorous process designed to identify those poised to make a lasting impact on the school community and beyond.

The Principal Mrs Leena Nair and the Vice Principal Mrs. Marykutty KT commended the newly appointed student leaders for their outstanding achievements and their readiness to serve as ambassadors of positive change. With their passion and drive, they are set to inspire their peers and lead by example, enriching the school experience for all.

13/05/2024

NESSS Stars Illuminate in the CBSE AISSCE 2023 Results

“Dream, dream, dream. Dreams transform into thoughts and thoughts result in action.”- A.P.J. Abdul Kalam

These profound words echo through the hallowed halls of New Era Senior Secondary School, igniting the flames of determination within each student. Their unwavering dedication and relentless pursuit of excellence have transformed aspirational dreams into remarkable accomplishments.

In the AISSCE 2023 (All India Senior School Certificate Examination), the stars of New Era Senior Secondary School blazed brightly across the academic sky. Their creditable scores stand as monuments to their tireless efforts, resilience, and unwavering commitment to learning. The results are not just numbers; they represent the journey of turning dreams into reality.

100 % PASS RESULT

APPEARED - 148 students

28% STUDENTS HAVE SCORED ABOVE 90%

74% STUDENTS HAVE SCORED ABOVE 80%

91% STUDENTS HAVE SCORED ABOVE 70%

98% STUDENTS HAVE SCORED ABOVE 60%

Science Toppers 2023-2024

School Rank 1 - DIVA PATEL - 97.2%, CBSE BOARD TOPPER IN CHEMISTRY 100/100

School Rank 2 - AMOGH BHAMERKAR - 97%, CBSE BOARD TOPPER IN CHEMISTRY 100/100

School Rank 3 - JEEA SANGHANI - 96.6%, CBSE BOARD TOPPER IN PSYCHOLOGY 100/100

Commerce Toppers 2023-2024

School Rank 1 - Kanishq Kadia - 98%, CBSE BOARD TOPPER IN PHYSICAL EDUCATION 100/100

School Rank 1 - Mahak Barjatya - 98%, CBSE BOARD TOPPER IN PSYCHOLOGY 100/100

School Rank 2 - Samhita Joshi - 97.2%

School Rank 3 - Kashvi Singh - 96%, CBSE BOARD TOPPER IN PAINTING 100/100

Humanities Toppers 2023-2024

CITY TOPPER - School Rank 1 - Madhura Bhave - 99%, CBSE BOARD Topper in Psychology, English & Political Science 100/100

School Rank 2 - Kashwi Srivastava - 96.8%, CBSE BOARD Topper in Psychology 100/100

School Rank 3 - Aneesh Joshi - 96.2%, CBSE BOARD Topper in Psychology 100/100

Year after year, these young New Eraites uphold the sacred tradition of fostering excellence. Their stellar performances not only illuminate their individual achievements but also serve as guiding constellations for others to follow.

But New Era School doesn’t rest on laurels. We adapt, evolve, and innovate. Our unique imprint, carefully crafted to meet the growing needs of the future, offers a whole new learning experience. State-of-the-art amenities, meticulously categorized facilities, and a harmonious blend of academics and engaging activities create an environment where brilliance thrives.

So, congratulations to the students of New Era Senior Secondary School! Your achievements are not just milestones; they are beacons lighting the path to greatness. The New Era Family acknowledges the efforts of every individual in grade 12th, for giving us this over-the-moon moment with your sterling result.

10/05/2024

NESSS Empowers Educators with a Reflective cum Innovative Workshop

New Era Senior Secondary School (NESSS) is thrilled to announce the addition of Mrs Rupa Arun to its esteemed team as Advisory. With the induction of the new member, the school even proudly announces a major stride in advancing educational excellence with the successful completion of a two-day workshop focused on empowering teachers to embrace learning, unlearning, and relearning.

The workshop, spearheaded by Mrs. Rupa Arun, a renowned education expert, saw enthusiastic participation from over 75 dedicated educators from NESSS. Through interactive sessions and hands-on activities, teachers reflected on and delved into various aspects of curriculum design, instructional strategies, assessment techniques, and classroom management. The program equipped educators with the latest tools and techniques to engage students effectively and create dynamic learning environments.

In alignment with the National Education Policy 2020 (NEP 2020), NESSS remains committed to enhancing its curriculum and practices. Initiatives like the intensive teacher training program underscore NESSS's dedication to staying at the forefront of educational innovation and ensuring student success in the 21st century.

Principal Mrs. Leena Nair expressed her excitement about these developments, stating, "At NESSS, we are committed to providing our students with a world-class education. The addition of Mrs. Rupa Arun to our team and the successful implementation of the teacher training program are significant steps towards achieving this goal."

The NESSS family eagerly anticipates building on these successes and continuing to inspire excellence in education.

ATL Community Day Celebrations @NESSS

Unlocking Collective Wisdom and Empowering Innovators through the Think-Pair-Share Approach

On April 26, 2024, New Era Senior Secondary School radiated with enthusiasm and joy as it celebrated ATL Community Day, showcasing innovation and scientific mindset at its finest. The fervor of over 50 students from Guiding Light Education (Tulsiwadi Hall, Karelibaugh, Vadodara) and Podar School (Chhani, Vadodara), ignited a spirit of collaborative learning, making it a resounding success.

The occasion was graced by the Managing Trustee, Dr. Geetika Madan Patel, who motivated the young minds to believe in their ideas and work hard to bring them to fruition. The school Principal, Mrs. Leena Nair, also highlighted the importance of collaboration and critical thinking among today's youth to bring about a revolutionary change at the grassroots level.

Mr. Krunal Shah, an esteemed ex-Big 4 Consultant, Social Entrepreneur, Leadership Coach, and Storyteller, led an engaging Design Thinking session for all students, igniting creativity and innovation. As a collaborative group activity, students creatively crafted various types of caps from a given sheet of paper, fostering creativity, teamwork and problem-solving skills.

Additionally, during their visit, the students embarked on a tour of the ATAL lab, the Kalam Maker Space, and Avishkar- the Mega Science Exhibition at NESSS. This provided them with a unique hands-on learning experience and valuable insights into the functions of various scientific equipment. They had the privilege of witnessing a diverse range of avant-garde projects and experiments carried out by New Eraites. The students were particularly impressed with the innovative prototypes presented by New Eraites, including the Fog Saver, Khet Jod Yantra, Accident Prevention Truck, and Trash Cleaning Robot. The practical solutions and creativity of the New Eraites were well-appreciated by the students.

The celebration was a resounding success, with attendees providing glowing feedback. This has reinforced NESSS's dedication to fostering innovation and community involvement. Moving forward, NESSS is fully committed to hosting more such events, providing opportunities for young minds to thrive and contribute to the larger community.

30/04/2024

AVISHKAR at NESSS: A Trailblazing Innovation and Technology Exhibition!

New Eraites sparkled their new academic year with innovative ideas demonstrated through experiments and models in its first Mega event – AVISHKAR, a Science and Technology based exhibition cum competition. A whopping number of 1000 plus New Eraites from PS1 to SS 4 donned the avatar of budding scientists and innovators in this scientific extravaganza. The main purpose of this display cum contest was to inspire students to use their idea that will solve the issues crippling the planet and to use science for a progressive nation. It was also to uncover the hidden talents of students and offer them exclusive practical learning experiences that combine various skills - such as critical thinking, problem-solving, data analysis, computer science, and public speaking - into a single project.

The AVISHKAR exhibition showcased a diverse array of projects by NESSS students, ranging from solar car, Electric battery charging station, electrolysis and water purification to space stations and rocket launchers. Through hands-on learning experiences, the pupils demonstrated not only technical skills but also presented simple yet plausible solutions to real-world challenges. The exhibition found the presence of Dr. Geetika Madan Patel, the Managing Trustee, who showed keen interest and interacted with confident students as they explained their intricate projects and experiments displayed in the vibrant classrooms. The exhibition received expert evaluation from judges Dr. Kukoo Mukherjee, AVV’s PGT Physics, Dr. Sonal Prakashkar, AVV’s PGT Biology, Ms.Seema Kadri, AVV’s PGT Chemistry, Mr. Nikhil Jumde, Incubation Manager at PU and Mr. Prashant Khanna, Incubation Manager at PU alongside New Era teachers, inspiring and motivating participants.

The Science exhibition was attended by a large number of parents who enjoyed and appreciated the pupils’ work on display. The positive reviews from parents and visitors were a testament to the hard work, creativity, and dedication of New Eraites. Kudos to the pillar of strength- the Principal, Mrs. Leena Nair, the genius mentors of the Science Department, and the unwavering support of New Era Faculty, and Staff for making this event a grand success.

26/04/2024

Shaping Future Leaders & Inspiring Democracy - NESSS Sparks Civic Engagement with National Youth Parliament - Kishore Sabha

New Era Senior Secondary School proudly hosted the National Youth Parliament – Kishore Sabha, an initiative by CBSE which is launched by the Ministry of Parliamentary Affairs.

As the nation gears up for general elections, the youth parliament sessions at NESSS echoed the pulse of democracy, fostering active citizenship and shaping the leaders of tomorrow.

The event not only aimed to instill democratic values, promote discipline, and foster tolerance towards diverse perspectives among students, but also provided insights into the parliamentary practices and procedures.

The one-hour rigorous program commenced with the arrival of the honorable Chief Guest, Mrs Ami Rawat, a name synonymous to great leadership in the field of politics. Under the stewardship of Incharge Teacher, Mrs Susmita Basu and the NYP Coordinator Mrs Anuradha Kacker, the event unfolded seamlessly.

A total of 47 budding leaders from classes IX to XII participated in the program, which began with the oath-taking process and progressed to engaging debates and discussions. Topics of discussion included the National Education Policy 2020, Agricultural Reforms, leveraging Artificial Intelligence, security concerns in Arunachal Pradesh, and media ethics in times now.

The session concluded with a voting process, that resulted in a tie after two delegates abstained. The Sabha concluded with the words of appreciation from the Chief Guest, acknowledging the students' dedication and enthusiasm.

The NYP team at NESSS pledges to continue organizing such sessions and give leaders of tomorrow a platform to raise concerns and discuss issues that matter them.
